author: parithosh
content:
pre-allocated balances were for precompiles if i'm not wrong.

The pre-allcoated storage for the deposit contract was to ensure its present at genesis, that way we could spin up the PoW and PoS chain together, instead of having to wait for the PoW chain to be up and then deploy a deposit contract to it.

author: kedos25.eth
content: I think anyone can join Goerli after the merge. You can currently set up a validator on Prater to test the merge transition.

author: benjaminion
content: It's 1 Wei, not 1 ETH, and as <@199561711278227457> says, it's for precompiles. This has a rather interesting history: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/716#issuecomment-330824096 - it avoids the precompiles being seen as "empty" accounts, which got us into trouble once upon a time.

author: yorickdowne
content: It's early and I am just having coffee so I'll indulge both of us by briefly going into the pickle we're in, and why another testnet doesn't solve it.

author: yorickdowne
content: G√∂rli farmers are "rational actors", they want to make a buck.

author: yorickdowne
content: For this they need G√∂rli to have value. This can be achieved by creating scarcity: Drain faucets and force them into ever-more-onerous Sybil resistance

author: yorickdowne
content: You then end up with people willing to pay for G√∂rli because they don't want to deal with PoW or BrightID to get test ETH

author: yorickdowne
content: This works the same with any testnet

author: yorickdowne
content: It is (nearly) free to drain faucets, hence it is rational to do so and attempt to create scarcity and thus value
